mfa.description:
**Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)** is now mandatory across our organization. This security measure is required for accessing your Microsoft account, logging into partner platforms via **Single Sign-On (SSO)**, and for performing password resets.

**Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)** is enforced company-wide to protect your identity and data. Multi-factor verification is required for the following actions:

Accessing your corporate **Microsoft account**.

Authenticating via **Single Sign-On (SSO)** with external partners.

Initiating self-service password changes.

vpn.description:
Think of FortiClient VPN as a secure digital bridge between your computer and the office. Even if you are working from home or a coffee shop, turning this app on connects you directly to the company network. It allows you to access internal files, printers, and software exactly as if you were sitting at your desk, while keeping the connection safe from outsiders.

Let's get started!

steps.text: Please check that your username and password are correctly written. To prevent issues when you change your password, please uncheck the "Save Password" and "Auto Connect" boxes.

Before pressing the "Connect" button, please ensure that the correct "Client Certificate" is selected.

The correct client certificate should be "Your Name [username] / ModernSubCAXX" - where "XX" cand be 01, 02 or 03. In some cases it can be the email address and "ModernSubCAXX"

Then press "Connect".
An example on how the FortiClient VPN looks like when the connection is successfully.

Troubleshooting in case the FortiClient VPN is not configured: 

Connection Name - Pulse-VPN-ALL"

Remote Gateway - https://geo.remote.prysmiangroup.com:443/pulse

Customize port checked and the port is 443

Username - your AD username (abcdefg00x)
steps.title: Troubleshooting

steps.text:
Troubleshooting in case the EMS server is not configured

You will need to enter "fcmanager.prysmian.com:8013" and check if the VPN client can connect to the EMS licensing server.

If this is unsuccessful, please contact Service Desk department, in order to collect more information and assist you in solving the issue.

outlook.description:
Think of **Outlook** as your daily command center. It is much more than just an email inbox. It is the central hub where you will manage your calendar, schedule meetings, and store your contacts. We use it to stay organized, coordinate with the team, and ensure everyone is on the same page regarding deadlines and events. 

Combined with **Microsoft Copilot**, it is a game-changer that turns brief notes into polished emails and summarizes complex conversations instantly to save you time

steps.title: WebMail
steps.text:
Access your work email securely from any device using Outlook Webmail. Simply log in with your Prysmian credentials to stay connected on personal computers or smartphones when the standard Outlook app is not an option.

Access it at: https://outlook.office365.com/mail/

steps.title: Outlook
steps.text:
1. Initial Launch

Open Outlook from the Start Menu or your Taskbar.

Wait briefly: You will see a "Searching for accounts" or "Loading Profile" status. Since your credentials are integrated with your Windows login, Outlook will configure your mailbox automatically without prompting for a password.

Once the main inbox appears, your email is ready to use.

steps.title: Outlook Signature
steps.text:
2. Set Up Your Email Signature

Go to File > Options.

Select Mail from the left menu.

Click on Signatures...

Click New, name your signature (e.g., "Standard"), and paste your contact details/company footer in the text box.

Important: Under "Choose default signature," select your new signature for both "New messages" and "Replies/forwards" to ensure it appears automatically.

steps.title: Reading Pane
steps.text:
3. Adjust Your View (Reading Pane)

Click the View tab at the top ribbon.

Click Reading Pane to choose your preference:

Right: Displays the email content to the right of your list (standard widescreen setup).

Bottom: Displays content below the list.

Off: Displays only the list of emails.

steps.title: Set Work Hours (Calendar)
steps.text:
4. Set Work Hours (Calendar)

Go to File > Options > Calendar.

Under "Work time," set your Start time and End time and check the boxes for your working days (e.g., Mon-Fri).

This ensures that when colleagues schedule meetings with you, they can see when you are officially available.

steps.title: Automatic Replies (Out of Office)
steps.text:
5. Automatic Replies (Out of Office)

Note: Set this only when you are away.

Go to File > Automatic Replies.

Select Send automatic replies and define the date range and message for times you are unavailable.

steps.title: Manage Add-ins (Enable/Disable)
steps.text:
6. Manage Add-ins (Enable/Disable)
Occasionally, add-ins such as Microsoft Teams may be automatically disabled and vanish from the meeting creation menu. If you encounter this issue, please follow the steps below to re-enable the add-in:

Access the Menu: Go to File > Options > Add-ins.

Manage COM Add-ins: At the bottom of the window, ensure the "Manage" dropdown is set to COM Add-ins and click Go...

Enable/Disable:

To Enable: Check the box next to the add-in you want to use.

To Disable: Uncheck the box next to the add-in you want to turn off.

Save: Click OK to apply the changes.

If the Add-in is disabled an cannot be enabled, even if you check the box in Manage COM Add-ins, go to Disabled Items, under COM Add-ins and enable the add-in from there.

mobile.description:
# What is an APN?

An **APN (Access Point Name)** acts as a digital gateway between your mobile carrier's cellular network (GSM, 4G, 5G) and the public internet.

Think of it as a "virtual bridge" or an address that tells your phone exactly how to connect to your provider's data services. It determines the correct IP address, security settings, and network path needed for connectivity.

Key functions:

Establishes Connection: It allows your device to browse the web using mobile data.

Enables MMS: It is often required to send multimedia messages (photos/videos).

Automatic Configuration: While most phones download these settings automatically when you insert a SIM card, they sometimes require manual setup to work correctly.

In short: Without the correct APN settings, your phone connects to the cellular tower for calls, but cannot access the internet.

The **APN** in **Prysmian** is: **netmon.vodafone.it**

steps.text:
Go to Settings > Connections > Mobile Networks.

Tap Access Point Names.

Tap Add (or the + icon).

Enter the following details:

Name: Vodafone Netmon

APN: netmon.vodafone.it

Tap the Menu (three dots) and select Save.

Select the radio button next to the new APN to activate it.
steps.title: Android APN Setup

steps.text:
Go to Settings.

Tap Cellular (or Mobile Data).

Tap Cellular Data Network (or Mobile Data Network).

Under the Cellular Data section, enter the following:

APN: netmon.vodafone.it

Username: (Leave blank)

Password: (Leave blank)

Personal Hotspot: netmon.vodafone.it

Tap the < Back arrow to automatically save the settings.
steps.title: IoS/iPhone APN Setup

software_center.description:

ticketing.description:
The Service Portal is your centralized hub for all IT support requests and service management. It serves as the primary interface between employees and the IT Helpdesk, ensuring that every issue is tracked, prioritized, and resolved efficiently.

Key Features:

🎫 Submit Tickets: Report technical issues (hardware, software, network) or request new IT services directly.

📂 Knowledge Base: Access a library of self-help articles, FAQs, and troubleshooting guides to resolve common problems instantly.

📊 Track Status: Monitor the real-time progress of your open tickets and view historical requests.

✅ Approvals: Managers can review and approve access requests or software installations with a single click.

How to Access:

Use the "Open TickIT" button in the browser extension or navigate to the internal portal URL to get started - https://prysmiansd.service-now.com/sp .

To view ticket status - https://prysmiansd.service-now.com/sp?id=tickets

faq.q: How do I configure MFA (two-factor authentication)?
faq.a: 1. Go to https://myaccount.microsoft.com/ 2. Click on 'Security info' 3. Add Microsoft Authenticator as primary method 4. Scan the QR code with the Authenticator app 5. We recommend also adding a phone number as a backup method.

faq.q: How do I configure APN on my mobile phone?
faq.a: The APN setting for Prysmian is: netmon.vodafone.it | Android: Settings > Connections > Mobile Networks > Access Point Names > Add | iOS: Settings > Cellular > Cellular Data Network > APN

faq.q: Where do I find Software Center?
faq.a: 1. Open the Start Menu 2. Search for 'Software Center' 3. Navigate to the 'Applications' tab 4. Install the apps you need without administrator rights.

faq.q: How do I open an IT ticket?
faq.a: 1. Use the 'Need Help?' button in the app (opens TickIT in Teams) 2. Or go directly to: https://prysmiansd.service-now.com/sp 3. Fill out the form with details about your issue.

faq.q: I can't send MMS or access internet on my phone.
